channel.title: [Python]Pythagoras, yum
channel.description:
[code]## Pythagoras from math import sqrt
class Main(object): def carryOut(self, a, b): Hypotenuse = int(a) * int(a) + int(b) * int(b) print "a * a + b * b =", Hypotenuse Final = sqrt(int(Hypotenuse)) print "\n" print "Square rooting the answer leaves us with the answer:", Final print "\n" print "The hypotenuse is:", Final, "long!"
M = Main() a = raw_input("Length of side a: ") b = raw_input("Length of side b: ") M.carryOut(int(a), int(b)) [/code]
ic.

item.title: [Python]Pythagoras, yum
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

haticks:

any reason you use raw_input instead of input?

raw_input always returns a string, where as input returns on object which is from an evaluated expression.

Read full topic

item.title: [Python]Pythagoras, yum
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Cakenet IRC”] Cowie<CommunistChina> Cowie
Cowie<CommunistChina> Cowie
Cowie<CommunistChina> Cowie
Cowie<CommunistChina> Cowie
Cowie<CommunistChina> Cowie
Cowie<Cowie> WHAT
how do i run
python
it not wurk
when i open ur pythagora
it says
a
b
i put
5 nd 6
then it crashes
omg???[/quote]

Don’t just double click the file, because it will get both inputs, work it out, print out the answer and then close. Go to the Python console and execute it that way, thus meaning it runs but the window stays open.

Read full topic

item.title: [Python]Pythagoras, yum
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[code]## Pythagoras
from math import sqrt

class Main(object):
def carryOut(self, a, b):
Hypotenuse = int(a) * int(a) + int(b) * int(b)
print “a * a + b * b =”, Hypotenuse
Final = sqrt(int(Hypotenuse))
print “\n”
print “Square rooting the answer leaves us with the answer:”, Final
print “\n”
print “The hypotenuse is:”, Final, “long!”

M = Main()
a = raw_input("Length of side a: ")
b = raw_input("Length of side b: ")
M.carryOut(int(a), int(b))
[/code]

ic.

Read full topic
